= |elevation_ft = <!-- Area/postal codes & others --------> |postal_code_type = 3-digit postal code prefix |postal_code = 561 |area_code = |iso_code = NG.BY.YE |website = |footnotes = }} '''Yenagoa''' is a [[Local Government Areas of Nigeria|Local Government Area]] in [[Bayelsa State]], [[Nigeria]]. Its headquarters are in the town of Yenagoa (the State capital) in the south of the area at{{Coord|4|55|29|N|6|15|51|E|region:NG_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki}}. The LGA has an area of 706 kmÂ² and a population of 353,344 at the 2006 census. The [[postal code]] of the area is 561.<ref>{{cite web | title = Post Offices- with map of LGA | work = | publisher = NIPOST | url = http://www.nipost.gov.ng/PostCode.aspx | accessdate = 2009-10-20 }}</ref> Yenagoa is the traditional home of the [[Ijaw people|Ijaw]] people. The Ijaw form the majority of the bayelsa state. English is the official language, but [[Epie/Atissa language]], one of the [[Ijo languages]], is the major local language spoken in Yenagoa.{{Citation needed|date=May 2007}} Since attaining the status of state capital in 1996, construction and other activities have accelerated appreciably. Yenagoa's population is estimated at about 266,008 people.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} It is the home of the [[Bayelsa United FC]], a premier league [[football (soccer)|football club]]. == References == {{reflist}} {{Bayelsa State}} [[Category:Populated places in Bayelsa State]] [[Category:Local Government Areas in Bayelsa State]] [[Category:Nigerian state capitals]] {{Bayelsa-geo-stub}}
